revision.text:
{{Use British English|date=December 2011}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Gary Madine | image = Madine, Gary.jpg | image_size = | caption = Madine following a match for [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] in 2018 | fullname = Gary Lee Madine{{cite web |url=https://www.efl.com/siteassets/efl-documents/efl-professional-retain-list--free-transfers---2017-18.pdf |title=Club list of registered players: As at 19th May 2018: Cardiff City |publisher=English Football League |format=PDF |page=12 |accessdate=17 June 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1990|8|24|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Gateshead]], England | height = {{convert|1.93|m|order=flip}}{{cite web |url=https://www.cardiffcityfc.co.uk/teams/first-team/forward/gary-madine/ |title=Gary Madine |publisher=Cardiff City F.C. |accessdate=18 December 2018}} | position = [[Forward (association football)#Striker|Striker]] | currentclub = [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]]
(on loan from [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]]) | clubnumber = 14 | youthyears1 = 2004–2007 | youthclubs1 = [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]] | years1 = 2007–2011 | years2 = 2009 | years3 = 2009 | years4 = 2010 | years5 = 2011–2015 | years6 = 2014 | years7 = 2014–2015 | years8 = 2015 | years9 = 2015–2018 | years10 = 2018– | years11 = 2019– | clubs1 = [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]] | clubs2 = → [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]] (loan) | clubs3 = → [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] (loan) | clubs4 = → [[Chesterfield F.C.|Chesterfield]] (loan) | clubs5 = [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] | clubs6 = → [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]] (loan) | clubs7 = → [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] (loan) | clubs8 = → [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] (loan) | clubs9 = [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] | clubs10 = [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] | clubs11 = → [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] (loan) | caps1 = 67 | caps2 = 3 | caps3 = 9 | caps4 = 4 | caps5 = 101 | caps6 = 5 | caps7 = 11 | caps8 = 15 | caps9 = 96 | caps10 = 18 | caps11 = 7 | goals1 = 14 | goals2 = 0 | goals3 = 0 | goals4 = 0 | goals5 = 26 | goals6 = 2 | goals7 = 3 | goals8 = 2 | goals9 = 24 | goals10 = 0 | goals11 = 2 | club-update = 19:32, 23 February 2019 (UTC) }} '''Gary Lee Madine''' (born 24 August 1990) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|striker]] on loan at [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] from [[Premier League]] side [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]]. Madine began his career with [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]], where he made his first team debut in 2007. He was sent out on loan in 2009, first with [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]] and then [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] before joining [[Chesterfield F.C.|Chesterfield]] in 2010 on loan. He signed a permanent contract with [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] in January 2011 for an undisclosed fee. ==Early life== Madine was born in [[Gateshead]], Tyne and Wear.{{Hugman|23990|accessdate=17 June 2018}} He attended local secondary school [[Lord Lawson of Beamish Community School|Lord Lawson of Beamish Comprehensive School]] from 2001–2006. He was originally on the books of [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]], however he was released and joined [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle]]. [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] players [[Alan Shearer]] and [[Chris Waddle]] were his heroes growing up.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/15310862 "Sheffield Wednesday's Gary Madine wins Football League Award"] BBC Sport. 14 October 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. ==Career== ===Carlisle United=== He progressed through the youth ranks of Carlisle, making his debut at the age of 17 on 3 March 2008, in a 1–0 away win against [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]], coming on as a substitute for [[Danny Graham (footballer)|Danny Graham]] in the 92nd minute.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~37198,00.html "Nottingham Forest 0–1 Carlisle"] Carlisle United F.C. 3 March 2008. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He went on to make 12 appearances that season, before signing a new three-year contract in June 2008.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/carlisle_united/7437713.stm "Madine awarded new Carlisle deal"] 5 June 2008. Retrieved 2 April 2012. His first appearances of the following season came in the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]], a 1–0 win away to [[Football League Two|League Two]] side [[Shrewsbury Town F.C.|Shrewsbury Town]] and a 4–0 defeat to [[Football League Championship|Championship]] side [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]].[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~46440,00.html "Shrewsbury 0–1 Carlisle"] Carlisle United F.C. 12 August 2008. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~46519,00.html "QPR 4–0 Carlisle"] Carlisle United F.C. 26 August 2008. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored his first goal for the club in a 4–1 win in the league against Yeovil Town on 30 August 2008.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~43652,00.html "Carlisle 4–1 Yeovil"] Carlisle United F.C. 30 August 2008. Retrieved 2 April 2012. His next goal came on 7 October in the [[Football League Trophy]], making the score 2–2 after [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]] had taken a 2-goal lead. The game went to penalties and Madine scored his however Carlisle lost the shoot-out 4–3.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~46564,00.html "Rochdale 2–2 Carlisle"] 7 October 2008. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored on his [[FA Cup]] debut as Carlisle drew 1–1 to [[Grays Athletic F.C.|Grays Athletic]] at [[Brunton Park]] on 8 November.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~46679,00.html "Carlisle 1–1 Grays Athletic"] Carlisle United F.C. 8 November 2008. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He played in the replay which Carlisle won 2–0, however Carlisle were eliminated in the next round by [[Crewe Alexandra F.C.|Crewe]].[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~46735,00.html "Grays Athletic 0–2 Carlisle"] 29 November 2008. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~46822,00.html "Carlisle 0–2 Crewe"] Carlisle United F.C. 3 December 2008. Retrieved 2 April 2012. On 20 March 2009, Madine signed on a month-long loan for [[Football League Two|League Two]] team [[Rochdale A.F.C|Rochdale]].[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/r/rochdale/7954646.stm "Madine leaves Cumbrians for Dale"] BBC Sport. 20 March 2009. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He made his debut the next day, setting up [[Adam le Fondre]] to score a last-minute winner as Rochdale beat [[Wycombe Wanderers F.C.|Wycombe]] 1–0.[http://www.rochdaleafc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10441~44985,00.html "Wycombe 0–1 Rochdale"] Rochdale A.F.C. 21 March 2009. Retrieved 2 April 2009. He made a further two appearances before returning to Carlisle.[http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=46584&season_id=138 "Gary Madine Football Stats Season 2008/2009"] Soccerbase. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored his first goal of the following season in a 2–0 League Cup win over Championship side [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]], helping Carlisle into the third round of the League Cup for the first time since 1976.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~50698,00.html "Bristol City 0–2 Carlisle"] Carlisle United F.C. 26 August 2009. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He made regular appearances before joining Championship side [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] on a three-month loan on 19 October 2009.[http://www.ccfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10269~1830879,00.html "Madine joins on loan"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091022062354/http://www.ccfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10269~1830879%2C00.html |date=22 October 2009 }} Coventry City F.C. 19 October 2009. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He made his debut on 24 October in a 0–0 draw against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Brom]] at the [[Ricoh Arena]].[http://www.ccfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10269~48291,00.html "Coventry 0–0 West Brom"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091027044205/http://www.ccfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0%2C%2C10269~48291%2C00.html |date=27 October 2009 }} Coventry City F.C. 24 October 2009. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He made 9 appearances before returning to Carlisle on 20 January 2010.[http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=46584&season_id=139 "Gary Madine Football Stats Season 2009/2010"] Soccerbase. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He made 4 appearances including a Football League Trophy Northern Area Final win on penalties against [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]], scoring his penalty in the shoot-out.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~51248,00.html "Carlisle 2–3 Leeds"] Carlisle United F.C. 9 February 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He then joined League Two side [[Chesterfield F.C.|Chesterfield]] on a month-long loan deal on 12 February.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/chesterfield/8513106.stm "Chesterfield sign striker Gary Madine from Carlisle"] BBC Sport. 12 February 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He made 4 appearances before returning to Carlisle.[http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=46584&season_id=139 "Gary Madine Football Stats Season 2009/2010"] Soccerbase. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He played and scored in the [[2010 Football League Trophy Final|Football League Trophy Final]] on 28 March 2010 at [[Wembley Stadium|Wembley]], scoring a consolation goal as Carlisle lost the game 4–1 to [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~51345,00.html "Carlisle 1–4 Southampton"] Carlisle United F.C. 28 March 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He began to find form and scored 4 goals in the last six matches of the season, with the goals coming against [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton]], [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham]], Southampton, and in a 2–0 win against league winners [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich]] on the final day of the season.[http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=46584&season_id=139 "Gary Madine Football Stats Season 2009/2010"] Soccerbase. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored on the opening day of the 2010–11 season, in a 2–0 home win against [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]].[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~52637,00.html "Carlisle 2–0 Brentford"] Carisle United F.C. 7 August 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012. His next goal came in a 4–1 win against [[MK Dons]] on 21 August.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~52729,00.html "Carlisle 4–1 MK Dons"] 21 August 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012. On 28 September, he scored a hat-trick in a 4–0 away win against rivals [[Hartlepool United F.C.|Hartlepool United]].[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~51485,00.html "Hartlepool 0–4 Carlisle"] Carlisle United F.C. 28 September 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012. After goals against [[Notts County F.C.|Notts County]] and [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton]], he scored 4 goals in a 6–0 FA Cup win against [[Tipton Town F.C.|Tipton Town]].[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~51552,00.html "Carlisle 1–0 Notts County"] Carlisle United F.C. 9 October 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~51656,00.html "Carlisle 3–4 Charlton"] Carlisle United F.C. 23 October 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~54818,00.html "Carlisle 6–0 Tipton"] Carlisle United F.C. 6 November 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012. In November, he scored in back-to-back games against Rochdale and [[Tamworth F.C.|Tamworth]].[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~52941,00.html "Carlisle 1–1 Rochdale"] 23 November 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~54851,00.html "Carlisle 3–2 Tamworth"] 27 November 2010. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He played his final game for Carlisle on 8 January 2011 in a 1–0 away defeat to [[Torquay United F.C.|Torquay United]] in the FA Cup.[http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10361~54940,00.html "Torquay 1–0 Carlisle"] 8 January 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He finished his Carlisle career with 83 appearances and 22 goals.[http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=46584&season_id=141 "Gary Madine Football Stats"] Soccerbase. Retrieved 2 April 2012. ===Sheffield Wednesday=== On 15 January 2011, Madine signed for [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]], signing a four and a half year contract.[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/s/sheff_wed/9362871.stm "Sheffield Wednesday sign Gary Madine & Mark Reynolds"] 16 January 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He made his debut on 22 January in a 4–0 away loss to [[Leyton Orient F.C.|Leyton Orient]].[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/9362036.stm "Leyton Orient 4–0 Sheff Wed"] BBC Sport. 22 January 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored on his second appearance 3 days later, in a 2–2 draw against [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]] at [[Hillsborough Stadium|Hillsborough]].[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/9369744.stm "Sheff Wed 2–2 Yeovil"] BBC Sport. 25 January 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored again the following game in a 5–3 defeat to [[Peterborough United F.C.|Peterborough]] at [[London Road Stadium|London Road]].[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/9377243.stm "Peterborough 5–3 Sheff Wed"] BBC Sport. 1 February 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. His next goal came in a 4–0 win against [[Tranmere Rovers F.C.|Tranmere]], and his final goal of the season came in a 2–0 win against Preston North End.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/12930639 "Sheff Wed 4–0 Tranmere"] 5 April 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17497480"] BBC Sport. 16 April 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He finished the season with 18 goals in all competitions for both Carlisle and Sheffield Wednesday.[http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=46584&season_id=140 "Gary Madine Football Stats Season 2010/2011"] Soccerbase. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored his first goal of the 2011–12 season in a 2–1 win against Notts County on 20 August 2011.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14514729 "Sheffield Wed 2–1 Notts County"] BBC Sport. 20 August 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. On 27 August he scored a brace as Sheffield Wednesday beat [[Scunthorpe United F.C.|Scunthorpe United]] 3–2.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14600461 "Sheffield Wed 3–2 Scunthorpe"] BBC Sport. 27 August 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. On 10 September he scored a brace in a 3–1 win against MK Dons,[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14773295 "Sheffield Wed 3–1 MK Dons"] BBC Sport. 10 September 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. and went on a 4-game goal-scoring run, scoring goals against [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]] and Yeovil, and a brace against [[Exeter City F.C.|Exeter]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14799570 "Stevenage 5–1 Sheffield Wed"] BBC Sport. 13 September 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14864001 "Yeovil 2–3 Sheffield Wed"] BBC Sport. 17 September 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14958283 "Sheffield Wed 3–0 Exeter"] BBC Sport. 24 September 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored his 10th goal of the season in a 3–1 win against Chesterfield.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/15135163 "Sheffield Wed 3–1 Chesterfield"] BBC Sport. 8 October 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored in the following game, this time in a 2–2 draw against city rivals [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]]. The game is known as the [[Steel City derby]], and after being two goals down, Wednesday scored two goals in the last 10 minutes including Madine's 85th-minute header to make the score 2–2. This was his first Sheffield derby.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/15231221 "Sheffield United 2–2 Sheffield Wed"] BBC Sport. 16 October 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He was named Football League Young Player of the Month for September, after scoring 10 goals in 12 games.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/15310862 "Sheffield Wednesday's Gary Madine wins Football League Award"] BBC Sport. 14 October 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[http://www.football-league.co.uk/league1/news/20111014/madine-named-young-player-of-the-month_2293324_2481770 "Madine named Young Player of the Month"] The Football League. 14 October 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. On 25 October he was sent off for the first time in his career, in a 3–2 loss at former club Carlisle.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/15346259 "Carlisle 3–2 Sheffield Wed"] BBC Sport. 25 October 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He broke his toe during a 2–1 win against Tranmere on 19 November and was out for six weeks.[http://www.sheffieldtelegraph.co.uk/news/madine-warning-injury-break-s-not-a-holiday-1-3998455 "Madine warning: 'Injury break not a holiday'"] Sheffield Telegraph. 24 November 2011. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He bounced back from his injury by scoring in his second game back during a 2–2 draw against Hartlepool.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/16559597 "Sheffield Wed 2–2 Hartlepool"] BBC Sport. 21 January 2012. Retrieved 2 April 2012. On 6 March 2012, he scored in a 4–1 win against [[Bury F.C.|Bury]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17187826 "Sheffield Wed 4–1 Bury"] BBC Sport. 6 March 2012. Retrieved 2 April 2012. Later that month he scored in back to back games in a 2–1 win against [[Notts County F.C.|Notts County]] and an injury time equaliser in 2–2 draw against [[Walsall F.C.|Walsall]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17323704 "Notts County 1–2 Sheffield Wed"] BBC Sport. 17 March 2012. Retrieved 2 April 2012.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17349082 "Sheffield Wed 2–2 Walsall"] BBC Sport. 20 March 2012. Retrieved 2 April 2012. On 31 March he scored two goals as Sheffield Wednesday beat [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston]] 2–0 at home.[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17497480 "Sheffield Wed 2–0 Preston"] BBC Sport. 31 March 2012. Retrieved 2 April 2012. He scored his first league goal of the 2012–13 season on 9 November, in a 3–1 defeat away to [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20177121 "Middlesbrough 3–1 Sheff Wed"] BBC Sport. 9 November 2012. Retrieved 9 November 2012. On 27 March 2014, Madine re-joined his former club [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]] on loan until the end of the [[2013–14 Football League One|2013–14]] season.{{Cite web |title=LOAN: Striker makes a return |url=http://www.carlisleunited.co.uk/news/article/madineloan27mar14-1446851.aspx |work=Carlisle United FC |date=27 March 2014}} ====Coventry City (loan)==== Madine re-joined [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]] on a one-month loan on 30 October 2014.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29832347|title=Gary Madine: Coventry re-sign Sheffield Wednesday striker|publisher=BBC Sport|date=30 October 2014|accessdate=30 October 2014}} He scored in the club's 1–0 victory over [[Colchester United F.C.|Colchester United]] on 22 November after scoring his first goal back in the [[Football League Trophy]] tie against [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.]] at the [[Ricoh Arena]]. He was named the club's Player of the Month by [[Coventry Telegraph]] in December, after scoring again in a 2–0 victory over [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] at [[Vale Park]] on 13 December.{{cite web |url=http://www.coventrytelegraph.net/sport/football/football-news/gary-madine-your-telegraph-coventry-8233487 |title=Gary Madine is YOUR Telegraph Coventry City Player of the Month|publisher=Coventry Telegraph|first=Aidan|last=McCartney|date=5 December 2014 |accessdate=10 February 2015}} ====Blackpool (loan)==== Madine joined [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] on loan until the end of the 2014–15 season on 10 February 2015.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31372174|title=Gary Madine: Sheffield Wednesday striker joins Blackpool|publisher=BBC Sport|date=10 February 2015|accessdate=10 February 2015}} ===Bolton Wanderers=== On 8 June, Madine signed a two-year deal with [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] .{{cite news|url=http://www.theboltonnews.co.uk/sport/wanderers/13318060.Wanderers_set_to_sign_duo_as_Lennon_begins_reeling_in_transfer_targets/|title=Wanderers set to sign duo as Lennon begins reeling in transfer targets|publisher=Bolton News|date=8 June 2015|accessdate=8 June 2015}} On 26 September, he scored his first goal for Bolton in a 2–2 draw with [[Brighton & Hove Albion]].{{cite news|title=Bolton 2–2 Brighton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34299016|accessdate=28 September 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 September 2015}} On 31 May 2017 the club confirmed that Madine had signed a new two-year contract, keeping him at the club until 2019.{{Cite news |title=Madine pens new deal with Whites |url=https://www.bwfc.co.uk/news/2017/may/madine-pens-new-deal-with-whites/ |publisher=Bolton Wanderers Official Site |date=31 May 2017 |accessdate=31 May 2017}} ===Cardiff City=== On 31 January 2018, Madine joined [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] for an undisclosed fee.{{cite web |url=https://www.cardiffcityfc.co.uk/news/2018/january/done-deal--gary-madine-signs-for-the-bluebirds/ |title=Gary Madine signs for the Bluebirds |publisher=Cardiff City F.C. |date=31 January 2018 |accessdate=31 January 2018}} His debut came three days later in a 4–1 win over [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]].{{cite news |title=Leeds United 1–4 Cardiff City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42841902 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 February 2018 |accessdate=3 February 2018}} On 7 January 2019, he joined Championship side [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] on loan for the remainder of the 2018–19 season.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46786641 |title=Gary Madine: Sheffield United sign Cardiff City striker on loan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 January 2019 |accessdate=7 January 2019}} ==Criminal convictions== Madine has been convicted of several assaults. In November 2010 he was found guilty of causing actual bodily harm after attacking a man in a pub and sentenced to community service involving 250 hours of unpaid work. He was also ordered to pay £1,500 compensation to his victim and £1,800 in costs.{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-cumbria-11724475 | title=Carlisle standing by Gary Madine over pub assault | publisher=BBC News | date=10 November 2010 | accessdate=5 October 2013}} In October 2013 he was jailed for 18 months after being found guilty of causing actual bodily harm and grievous bodily harm in two separate attacks.{{cite web | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-south-yorkshire-24398799 | title=Gary Madine jailed for Sheffield nightclub attacks on fans | publisher=BBC News | date=4 October 2013 | accessdate=5 October 2013}} Madine was released from jail on 20 February 2014 after serving 5 months of his 18-month sentence.http://www.thestar.co.uk/news/crime/disgraced-sheffield-wednesday-striker-released-from-jail-1-6452062 ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 3 November 2018}}{{soccerbase|id=46584|name=Gary Madine}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|[[Football League|League]] !colspan="2"|[[FA Cup]] !colspan="2"|[[Football League Cup|League Cup]] !colspan="2"|[[Football League Trophy|League Trophy]] !colspan="2"|[[Football League play-offs|Play–Offs]] !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals |- |rowspan="2"|[[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle]] |[[2007–08 Football League|2007–08]] |[[Football League One|League One]] |11||0 |0||0 |0||0 |0||0 |1||0 |12||0 |- |[[2008–09 Football League|2008–09]] |[[Football League One|League One]] |14||1 |3||1 |2||0 |1||1 |0||0 |20||3 |- |rowspan="2"|[[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]] (Loan) |[[2008-09 Football League|2008–09]] |[[Football League Two|League Two]] |3||0 |0||0 |0||0 |0||0 |0||0 |3||0 |- !colspan=2|Total !3!!0 !0!!0 !0!!0 !0!!0 !0!!0 !3!!0 |- |rowspan="1"|[[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle]] |[[2009–10 Football League|2009–10]] |[[Football League One|League One]] |20||4 |0||0 |2||1 |3||1 |0||0 |25||6 |- |rowspan="1"|[[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry]] (Loan) |[[2009-10
